foragainst:prep[ME, fr.] 1a:-used as a function word to indicate being in favor or not in favor of the subject, depending on which way the party hearing or reading the word is inclined to be placated 1b:a fair description of John Kerry's stance on any given issue

pnac=ww3

Cool, Bush was foragainst an independent commission to investigate 9/11.
 
 Bush is foragainst finding Osama bin Laden.
 
 Bush is foragainst spending social security surplus.
 
 Bush was foragainst a UN vote for invasion of Iraq.
 
 Bush was foragainst the creation of DHS.
 
 Bush is foragainst states rights on gay marriage.
 
 Bush is foragainst "nation building."
 
 Bush is foragainst the assault weapons ban.
 
 Bush was foragainst McCain-Feingold.
 
 Bush is foragainst negotiating with North Korea.
 
 Bush is foragainst fingerprinting and photographing entering Mexicans.
 
 Bush is foragainst the Roadless Conservation Rule.
 
 My favorite:
 
 Bush is foragainst judicial activism. (Denounced in debate with Gore, but was fully for it when judicial activism handed him the white house.)
 
 Bush is foragainst the idea that the war on terrorism can be won.
 
 
 Bush is foragainst "issue ads."
 
 
Flip: "I believe individual freedom to participate in elections should be expanded, not diminished; and when individual freedoms are restricted, questions arise under the First Amendment. I also have reservations about the constitutionality of the broad ban on issue advertising, which restrains the speech of a wide variety of groups on issues of public import in the months closest to an election."
 
 Flop: "All of them. That means that ad, every other ad. Absolutely. I can't be more plain about it. I hope my opponent joins me in condemning these activities of the 527s (political groups that sponsor ads). I think they're bad for the system."
